DOC.brief_summary: To examine the effects of a music, imagery, and movement (MiM) intervention on emotional and cognitive functioning in residents living in a community-based adult long-term care facility. Hypothesis 1: Residents who participate in the MiM group will improve in emotional functioning, as compared to residents in the control group. Hypothesis 2: Residents who participate in the MiM group will improve in cognitive functioning, as compared to residents in the control group.
DOC.brief_title: Examining the Effects of (MiM) Treatment on Emotional and Cognitive Functioning of Residents in Long-term Care
DOC.detailed_description: To implement a community-based integrated music, art and imagery, and movement intervention to improve mood and promote cognitive functioning in older adult residents living in a long-term care facility.
DOC.criteria: Resident in assisted living at longterm care facility with MMSE score above 20 comorbid psychiatric diagnosis and/or staff clinical evaluation that determines inappropriateness for study inclusion
